title: Cardiovascular Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Niagara Health System
Interview Descriptions: was conducted VIA zoom due to the pandemic, was your typical interview, discussed job role and responsibilities, and asked questions pertaining to past experience, they were very friendly and open-minded as I was a new grad, in the end, didn't get the job because of CSCT registration pending
Interview Questions: Example of dealing with a difficult person and how it was combatted

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Niagara Health System
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process, but with fair questions. Fair amount of time between first and second interviews. Very competitive to weed out those with little experience or skills to offer.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Niagara Health System
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for the Project Manager role but was offered a Junior Project Manager role. Was not happy with being demoted at the start of a job offer. Declined the opportunity.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Niagara health?

title: Human Resource Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Niagara Health System (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a very smooth process.  Very well thought of keeping in mind the interview process is going to be virtual. There were three panelist for in the interview session.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Niagara Health System (Niagara, ON) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied through Indeed; received email from Niagara health;  Scheduled interview with Unit Manager. Face to face interview with unit manager and person from HR.  Did not require a skills  interview for the position I was applying to.
Interview Questions:
Why are you applying for this position? 
Related experience.
Dealing with conflict.

title: Service Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Niagara Health System (St. Catharines, ON) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was working in the Niagara Health system for a different position at the time, to my application was internal. My interview was pretty simple. I got brought into the Supervisors office and was presented with a package of behavioral questions. After they were complete, we spoke a little about the role and was told I would hear from them within the week.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had a lot of responsibilities at once, and how did you determine what to do first?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Niagara Health System (St. Catharines, ON) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Review of qualifications and scenario-based skill questions. Questions involved situation-based use of nursing knowledge. I was asked how I would perform nursing care in a given set situation. I also was asked to provide an example of how I performed nursing care in a specific way. Review of my resume was very brief and most of my interview was focused on answering questions
Interview Questions: In a situation where a patient of sound mind is refusing a medical treatment, how would you attempt to convince the patient otherwise?

title: Anything Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Niagara Health System
Interview Descriptions: Had to do a math test, answer personal questions, have some kind of job experience with cash. Asked what I would like as pay? Where do I see myself with this company in 5 years?  When can I start?  Explain a situation that happened at work I had to fix.
Interview Questions: What would you do if this senerio happened?

title: Casual Then Part-time RN Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Niagara Health System (Saint Catharines, ON)
Interview Descriptions: The office of the manager was difficult to find. I was Interviewed by the manage the department in their office. The interview lasted less than 30 minutes. The interview was very low key foscused mainly on psycho-social questions, less on critical care issues for job.
Interview Questions: how I would resolve conflict between staff, MD or client?

title: Dietary Food Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Niagara Health System (Welland, ON) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The Process was very thorough but yet comfortable. Two Supervisors interviewed me. One asked about my experience and the other asked more about situations and how would I handle them, personal and professional.  Very professional!
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for the NHS
